title: Drawing, "Design for the West Wall of the Music Room, for Brighton Pavilion", ca. 1817
medium: Brush and watercolor, gouache over traces of graphite on white wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
description:
Elevation of west wall, with the two large wall paintings of bamboo trees and pagodas flanking the fireplace. The wall panels are flanked by paintings of Chinese columns entwined by serpents. The coved section is shown above on separate piece of paper, with three lozenge-shaped painted glass panels. Alternative design painted underneath.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory.

exhibitions.title: House Proud: 19th Century Watercolor Interiors from the Thaw Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for the West Wall of the Music Room, for Brighton Pavilion", ca. 1817.
